8. ARBITRATION
8.1 Any and all disputes, claims or differences arising out of or relating to this agreement or the alleged breach thereto shall be settled by mutual consultation between the parties in good faith as promptly as possible but failing such amicable settlement, shall be decided by Arbitration by the Arbitration Committee of the International Chamber of Commerce located in Switzerland.
8.2 The language to be used in the Arbitration proceedings shall be English.
8.3 The award/decision of the Arbitration Committee shall be final and binding on both the parties and enforceable in any jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text:
14.8 New Products Designed, Formulated and Supplied by the Manufacturer
8.1 Any and all disputes, claims or differences arising out of or relating to this agreement or the alleged breach thereto shall be settled by mutual consultation between the parties in good faith as promptly as possible but failing such amicable settlement, shall be decided by Arbitration by the Arbitration Committee of the International Chamber of Commerce located in Switzerland.
8.2 The language to be used in the Arbitration proceedings shall be English.
8.3 The award/decision of the Arbitration Committee shall be final and binding on both the parties and enforceable in any jurisdiction.
The Manufacturer agrees to maintain its focus on the design and formulation of new products and agrees to provide the Customer with one new product each quarter for a minimum of four (4) new products per year. The Manufacturer agrees to give the Customer exclusive rights to the marketing, promotion and sales of the new products should the Customer decide to take on the new products.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the arbitration clause to a section about 'New Products' makes it less likely to be noticed during contract review. The placement under a heading concerning product development obscures its significance as a method of dispute resolution, thereby hindering its enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Dispute Resolution Clause Requirements

perturbation.original_text:
10. GOVERNING LAW
This agreement shall be governed by the Laws of England (English common and statutory Law).
perturbation.changed_text:
14.9 Other products outside of the product range listed in schedule A of this document
This agreement shall be governed by the Laws of England (English common and statutory Law).
The Manufacturer agrees that the Customer has the right under this agreement to consider, source, promote, market and sell other product outside of the products listed in Schedule A of this agreement in line with the following assumptions:
That they are non-competing products to the range of products or those products listed in schedule A of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Placing the governing law clause in the section 'Other products outside of the product range' makes it less prominent and easily overlooked. This diminishes its effectiveness, as parties might miss the jurisdiction under which the contract will be interpreted.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Governing Law Clause Requirements

perturbation.original_text:
11. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
The Manufacturer is the owner of the intellectual Property pertaining to the products listed in schedule A of this agreement as well as to the book 'How to Achieve Super Health beyond 2000 - Advanced Edition'
perturbation.changed_text:
14.10 HOW TO ACHIEVE SUPER HEALTH BEYOND 2000 - ADVANCED EDITION BOOK
The Manufacturer is the owner of the intellectual Property pertaining to the products listed in schedule A of this agreement as well as to the book 'How to Achieve Super Health beyond 2000 - Advanced Edition'
The Manufacturer has appointed the Customer the copyright holder of both the English and the Chinese version of the book How to achieve Super Health beyond 2000 - Advanced Edition, authored by Frank D.P. Ellis and Dr. Michael Tait M.D. This appointment shall be deemed valid provided the Customer fulfils and maintains the criteria of this agreement. The Customer will provide the Manufacturer with prior notification of printing runs of the book and the quantity of books to be printed in each run. The Customer will compensate the Manufacturer the amount of AUS $1.00 per book prior to printing.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the general intellectual property ownership statement into a section specifically about a particular book diminishes the importance of the overall IP rights of the manufacturer for all products. This could create ambiguity and potentially weaken the protection afforded to the manufacturer's broader intellectual property.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law - Clear Declaration of Ownership
